lead_paragraph: On Friday, the American Museum of Natural History will unveil the cast of a 122-foot-long dinosaur that is one of the largest ever found. It is too big, in fact, to fit completely inside its new home.

headline.print_headline: Clattering Titan of Yore Lumbers Into the Spotlight
headline.main: New Dinosaur Poses Question: Does This Museum Make Me Look Fat?

snippet: On Friday, the American Museum of Natural History will unveil the cast of a 122-foot-long dinosaur that is one of the largest ever found. It is too big, in fact, to fit completely inside its new home.
abstract: American Museum of Natural History is preparing to unveil cast of 122-foot-long dinosaur, which is as yet unnamed yet belongs to group known as titanosaurs; new species was discovered in Argentina in 2014 and museum president Ellen V Futter believes exhibition will join ranks of museum's other iconic exhibits.
